document_title: Single kidney cyst: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: nang-don-than.json_2_Who is at risk for simple kidney cysts?
subsection_content: Simple kidney cysts are a common disease in many different ages, but are more common in the elderly. The common incidence is about 25% of people over 40 years old, 50% of people over 50 years old and up to over 90% of people over 70 years old. Additionally, men are twice as likely as women to have solitary kidney cysts.
subsection_title: nang don than.json. Who is at risk for simple kidney cysts?
subsection_data:
nang don than.json. Who is at risk for simple kidney cysts?
Simple kidney cysts are a common disease in many different ages, but are more common in the elderly. The common incidence is about 25% of people over 40 years old, 50% of people over 50 years old and up to over 90% of people over 70 years old. Additionally, men are twice as likely as women to have solitary kidney cysts.
